questions.question_text_1: Read the statements given below carefully and select the correct option.  Statement 1: If an element is styled externally using two different classes and an ID, then for the same attribute, it will always acquire styling from the latest style in order. Statement 2: If an element is styled internally using ID and class selector as well as using inline styling for the same style attribute, then it will acquire styling from the ID selector.
question_texts: Read the statements given below carefully and select the correct option.  Statement 1: If an element is styled externally using two different classes and an ID, then for the same attribute, it will always acquire styling from the latest style in order. Statement 2: If an element is styled internally using ID and class selector as well as using inline styling for the same style attribute, then it will acquire styling from the ID selector.

options.option_text: Statement 1 is correct but statement 2 is incorrect
Statement 2 is correct but statement 1 is incorrect

options.option_text: To create a new database table

props.summary:
Here’s a structured summary of the **core topics, concepts, principles, and equations** essential for the **"Modern Application Development I"** exam, along with **Mermaid knowledge graphs** to visualize relationships. --- --- ### **1. Core Topics & Concepts** #### **A. Web Development Fundamentals** 1. **URL Structure** - Components: `Scheme` (e.g., `https`), `Domain` (e.g., `example.com`), `Path` (e.g., `/courses`), `Query Parameters` (e.g., `?type=lesson`). - Example: ``` https://seek.onlinedegree.iitm.ac.in/courses/ns_23t3_cs2003?type=lesson&tab=courses ``` - **Scheme**: `https` - **Domain**: `seek.onlinedegree.iitm.ac.in` - **Path**: `/courses/ns_23t3_cs2003` - **Query Parameters**: `type=lesson`, `tab=courses` 2. **HTTP Methods & Status Codes** - **Methods**: `GET`, `POST`, `PUT`, `DELETE`. - **Status Codes**: - `200 OK`: Success. - `400 Bad Request`: Client error (e.g., invalid input). - `401 Unauthorized`: Authentication failed. - `404 Not Found`: Resource not found. - `500 Internal Server Error`: Server-side issue. 3. **cURL** - Command-line tool for making HTTP requests. - Example: ```bash curl http://127.0.0.1:5000/api/v1 -X GET -d "{\"movie\": \"X-men\"}" -H "Content-Type: application/json" ``` 4. **CSS Selectors & Specificity** - **Specificity Hierarchy**: `!important` > Inline Styles > IDs > Classes > Elements. - Example: ```css h2 { color: blue; } /* Element selector */ .class { color: green; } /* Class selector */ #id { color: red; } /* ID selector */ ``` - **Pseudo-classes**: `:valid`, `:invalid` (for form validation). 5. **HTML Forms & Validation** - Attributes: `minlength`, `maxlength`, `required`. - Example: ```html ``` --- #### **B. Backend Development (Flask & Python)** 1. **Flask Basics** - Routes: `@app.route('/path')`. - Request Handling: `request.args`, `request.method`. - Sessions: `session['key'] = value`. - Error Handling: `@app.errorhandler(404)`. - Example: ```python from flask import Flask, request, session, abort app = Flask(__name__) app.secret_key = "secret" @app.route('/login', methods=['GET', 'POST']) def login(): if request.method == 'POST': user = request.form['user'] session['user'] = user return f"Logged in as {user}" return "Login Page" ``` 2. **Flask-RESTful** - Resources: `class Resource(Resource)`. - Parsing Arguments: `reqparse.RequestParser()`. - Marshaling: `@marshal_with(fields)`. - Example: ```python from flask_restful import Resource, reqparse, fields, marshal_with parser = reqparse.RequestParser() parser.add_argument('movie') parser.add_argument('genre') class TestAPI(Resource): @marshal_with({'film': fields.String}) def put(self): args = parser.parse_args() return {'film': args['movie']} ``` 3. **Database Integration (SQLAlchemy)** - Models: `db.Model`. - Relationships: `db.ForeignKey`, `db.relationship`. - CRUD Operations: `db.session.add()`, `db.session.commit()`. - Example: ```python from flask_sqlalchemy import SQLAlchemy db = SQLAlchemy(app) class User(db.Model): id = db.Column(db.Integer, primary_key=True) name = db.Column(db.String(50)) db.create_all() user = User(name="Alice") db.session.add(user) db.session.commit() ``` 4. **Jinja2 Templating** - Template Inheritance: `{% extends 'base.html' %}`. - Loops/Conditionals: `{% for %}`, `{% if %}`. - Filters: `{{ variable|upper }}`. - Example: ```html {% block title %}{% endblock %} {% block content %}{% endblock %} {% extends 'base.html' %} {% block title %}Child Page{% endblock %} {% block content %}

Hello!

{% endblock %} ``` --- #### **C. Frontend Development** 1. **Web Components** - Custom Elements: `class MyElement extends HTMLElement`. - Shadow DOM: `this.attachShadow({ mode: 'open' })`. - Example: ```javascript class MyComponent extends HTMLElement { connectedCallback() { this.innerHTML = `

Hello, World!

`; } } customElements.define('my-component', MyComponent); ``` 2. **HTML Tables & Rendering** - Basic Structure: ```html
Header
Data
``` - Dynamic Rendering with Jinja2: ```html {% for item in items %} {% endfor %}
{{ item.name }}
``` --- #### **D. Testing & Debugging** 1. **Pytest** - Fixtures: `@pytest.fixture`. - Markers: `@pytest.mark.marker_name`. - Assertions: `assert func(x) == expected`. - Example: ```python import pytest @pytest.mark.parametrize("x, expected", [(2, 4), (3, 9)]) def test_square(x, expected): assert x ** 2 == expected ``` 2. **Test Coverage** - **Branch Coverage**: All branches (e.g., `if-else`) are tested. - **Condition Coverage**: All conditions (e.g., `x > 0`) are tested. - **Statement**: 100% branch coverage ≠ 100% condition coverage. 3. **Debugging Python** - `sys.argv`: Command-line arguments. - Decorators: Modify function behavior. - Example: ```python import sys print(sys.argv[1]) # First command-line argument ``` --- #### **E. Version Control (Git)** 1. **Git Commands** - Configure User: ```bash git config --global user.email "email@example.com" ``` - Basic Workflow: ```bash git add . git commit -m "Message" git push origin main ``` --- #### **F. Networking Basics** 1. **IPv4 to Hexadecimal** - Convert each octet to hex. - Example: `172.16.254.10` → `AC.10.FE.0A`. 2. **Round-Trip Time (RTT)** - Formula: ``` RTT = (2 * distance) / speed_of_light ``` - Example: For 900 km, ``` RTT = (2 * 900,000 m) / (3 * 10^8 m/s) = 6 ms ``` --- #### **G. Software Design Principles** 1. **DRY (Don’t Repeat Yourself)** - Avoid code duplication (e.g., use functions/classes). 2. **Separation of Concerns** - Frontend (HTML/CSS/JS) vs. Backend (Python/Flask) vs. Database (SQL). --- --- ### **2. Key Equations (Mathematics/Networking)** | **Concept** | **Equation** | **Example** | |---------------------------|-----------------------------------------------|----------------------------------------------| | Round-Trip Time (RTT) | `RTT = (2 * distance) / speed_of_light` | `distance = 900 km → RTT = 6 ms` | | IPv4 to Hexadecimal | Convert each octet to hex | `172 → AC`, `16 → 10`, `254 → FE`, `10 → 0A` | | CSS Specificity | `!important > ID > Class > Element` | `#id { color: red; }` overrides `.class` | | Pytest Filtering | `pytest -m marker_name` | Run tests with `@pytest.mark.marker1` | | Flask Route Parameters | `@app.route('/path/')` | `/user/` → `def get_user(username)`| --- --- ### **3. Mermaid Knowledge Graphs** #### **Graph 1: Web Development Ecosystem** ```mermaid graph TD A[Web Development] --> B[Frontend] A --> C[Backend] A --> D[Database] B --> B1[HTML] B --> B2[CSS] B --> B3[JavaScript] B --> B4[Web Components] C --> C1[Flask] C --> C2[RESTful APIs] C --> C3[Jinja2 Templating] C --> C4[Session Management] D --> D1[SQLAlchemy] D --> D2[SQLite] D --> D3[Relationships] ``` #### **Graph 2: Flask Workflow** ```mermaid graph LR A[Client Request] --> B[Flask Route] B --> C{Request Method} C -->|GET| D[Render Template] C -->|POST| E[Process Data] E --> F[Update Database] F --> G[Return Response] D --> G ``` #### **Graph 3: Testing Pyramid** ```mermaid graph TD A[Testing] --> B[Unit Tests] A --> C[Integration Tests] A --> D[End-to-End Tests] B --> B1[Pytest] B --> B2[Assertions] C --> C1[API Tests] C --> C2[Database Tests] D --> D1[Selenium] D --> D2[Cypress] ``` #### **Graph 4: Git Workflow** ```mermaid graph LR A[Working Directory] -->|git add| B[Staging Area] B -->|git commit| C[Local Repository] C -->|git push| D[Remote Repository] ``` #### **Graph 5: HTTP Status Codes** ```mermaid graph TD A[HTTP Status Codes] --> B[1xx: Informational] A --> C[2xx: Success] A --> D[3xx: Redirection] A --> E[4xx: Client Error] A --> F[5xx: Server Error] C --> C1[200 OK] C --> C2[201 Created] E --> E1[400 Bad Request] E --> E2[401 Unauthorized] E --> E3[404 Not Found] F --> F1[500 Internal Server Error] ``` #### **Graph 6: CSS Specificity Hierarchy** ```mermaid graph TD A[CSS Specificity] --> B[!important] A --> C[Inline Styles] A --> D[IDs] A --> E[Classes] A --> F[Elements] B -->|Highest| G[Override All] C --> D D --> E E --> F ``` --- --- ### **4. Exam Tips** 1. **URL Components**: Memorize the structure (scheme, domain, path, query). 2. **Flask Routes**: Practice writing routes with dynamic parameters (e.g., `/user/`). 3. **Jinja2**: Focus on loops (`{% for %}`), conditionals (`{% if %}`), and template inheritance. 4. **Testing**: Understand `pytest` markers (`-m`), filtering (`-k`), and coverage types. 5. **Networking**: Calculate RTT using `distance` and `speed_of_light`. 6. **Git**: Know basic commands (`config`, `add`, `commit`, `push`). 7. **CSS**: Remember specificity rules and pseudo-classes (`:valid`, `:invalid`). 8. **Debugging**: Pay attention to `sys.argv` and decorator behavior. --- --- **Good luck!** Let me know if you'd like a deeper dive into any topic.
